title: Chinese defence stocks drop up to 9% after rising during Op Sindoor
content: Chinese defence stocks plummeted following a ceasefire between India and Pakistan, erasing earlier gains fueled by expectations of increased arms sales to Pakistan. The Hang Seng China A Aerospace & Defence Index saw a significant drop, with companies like AVIC Chengdu Aircraft and Zhuzhou Hongda experiencing substantial losses.

title: 'TRF a front of LeT; will push for it to be listed as terror entity at UNSC': MEA
content: India is set to push for the United Nations to designate The Resistance Front (TRF), an offshoot of Lashkar-e-Taiba, as a terrorist organization following several attacks in Jammu and Kashmir. The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) announced plans to send a team to the UNSC's 1267 Sanctions Committee meeting this week to pursue sanctions and travel bans on TRF members.

title: Indian Army briefs 70 nations on successful conduct of Operation Sindoor
content: Lt Gen D S Rana briefed defence attaches from 70 nations on Operation Sindoor's success, highlighting its impact on India-Pakistan relations. He emphasized India's military superiority and precise targeting of terror-linked sites. The briefing also addressed misinformation campaigns and showcased the integrated approach and technological advancements used in the operation.

title: Pakistani hackers attacked 1.5M+ Indian sites after Operation Sindoor
content: Following the Pahalgam terror strike, Maharashtra Cyber identified seven APT groups, primarily Pakistan-allied, responsible for over 1.5 million cyber attacks targeting critical Indian infrastructure. While only 150 attacks succeeded, these groups employed malware, DDoS attacks, and misinformation campaigns. The attacks originated from Pakistan, Bangladesh, the Middle East, and Indonesia, with some successful defacements and alleged data theft.

title: 'Awami League ban in Bangladesh without due process is concerning': India
content: India has voiced strong concerns over the recent political turmoil in Bangladesh, triggered by the banning of the Awami League under a revised anti-terrorism law. This action, along with the revocation of the party's registration, raises worries about shrinking democratic space. India urges Bangladesh to hold free and fair elections, emphasizing the importance of democratic freedoms.

title: Angry paps confront Virat Kohli at Mumbai airport
content: Following Virat Kohli's Test retirement announcement, paparazzi at the Mumbai airport expressed their disappointment, stating they would no longer watch cricket. Kohli, accompanied by Anushka Sharma, politely declined photos due to time constraints.

title: Traders body sends ‘Pakistan ban’ letter to govt on Amazon, Flipkart
content: The Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) has formally requested the government to prohibit the sale of Pakistani flags and related merchandise on e-commerce platforms like Amazon and Flipkart. This appeal, addressed to Union Ministers Piyush Goyal and Pralhad Joshi, emphasizes the insensitivity of such sales, especially during Operation Sindoor.

title: ‘Don’t politically penalise Modi govt for exploring peace’: Mufti
content: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti urged opposition parties to support the Modi government's peace initiatives, particularly the recent ceasefire. She emphasized the need for bipartisan statesmanship and a national consensus, drawing parallels to past leaders who engaged across borders during tense times. Mufti also criticized media narratives for distracting from real issues and fueling division.

title: Bomb scare delays Mumbai-bound flight at Kolkata airport, passenger detained
content: A passenger on an IndiGo flight from Kolkata to Mumbai triggered a bomb scare at Kolkata airport, leading to heightened security measures. The 26-year-old man made the suspicious comment during a pre-boarding security check, prompting immediate detention and a thorough inspection of the aircraft in an isolation bay.

title: 'I saw Test cricket mainly for Virat Kohli': Preity Zinta
content: Preity Zinta expressed her admiration for Virat Kohli's transformative impact on Test cricket following his sudden retirement. She highlighted his passion, character, and competitiveness, suggesting the game won't be the same. Zinta also acknowledged the significant void left by Kohli, Rohit Sharma and Ashwin, emphasizing the challenge for current players to fill their shoes.

title: US-China trade: Trump says he called Apple CEO after China tariff rollback and ...
content: Following a US-China trade agreement where tariffs are suspended for 90 days, President Trump claimed Apple CEO Tim Cook plans to increase US investments, potentially building more plants. This news follows reports of Apple considering iPhone price hikes, possibly linked to tariffs.

title: Owaisi takes 'leased Chinese aircraft' swipe at Shehbaz Sharif, Asim Munir
content: Asaduddin Owaisi mocked Pakistan's Prime Minister and army chief after the Indian Air Force reportedly struck the Rahim Yar Khan airbase in Pakistan. The strike, part of a retaliation for Pakistan's actions, rendered the runway non-operational. India's response followed a terrorist attack and included precision strikes on terror facilities, resulting in significant casualties.

title: Jos Buttler, Phil Salt set to miss rest of IPL 2025?
content: England Cricket embarks on a fresh chapter under captain Harry Brook, hosting Zimbabwe in a Test match before facing West Indies in ODIs and T20Is. Despite IPL 2025 clashes, key players like Buttler and Archer are available. Dawson and Wood return to the T20I squad, while Hartley joins the ODI setup.

title: Hailee Steinfeld drops major career bombshell after breakup advice goes viral
content: Hailee Steinfeld, known for her acting and singing career, is connecting with fans through emotional honesty and personal storytelling. From her role in 'Sinners' to her BEAU SOCIETY newsletter, she shares her experiences with identity, heartbreak, and self-discovery. Steinfeld's approach redefines celebrity engagement, making her a relatable voice for a generation navigating life's challenges.

title: April inflation hits multi-year low of 3.16%
content: The All India Consumer Price Index (CPI) or retail inflation for the month of April 2025 eased to 3.16% compared to April 2024. The food inflation experienced a significant reduction of 91 basis points in April 2025 compared to March 2025, marking its lowest point since October 2021.

title: Operation Keller: 3 LeT terrorists killed during encounter with Army in J&K's Shopian
content: Indian armed forces neutralized three Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorists in Shopian's Keller area, Jammu and Kashmir, following a search operation prompted by specific intelligence. This action follows India's declaration that future terror acts will be treated as acts of war, signaling a tougher stance against Pakistan-based groups.

title: PM Modi poses in front of S-400 missile system, sends message to Pakistan
content: Prime Minister Modi refuted Pakistan's claim of destroying India's S-400 air defense system by visiting the Adampur airbase and posing with the system. This follows Pakistan's disinformation campaign, including false videos, after India's Operation Sindoor. The Ministry of External Affairs exposed Pakistan's false claims about damaging the S-400 and BrahMos missile base.

title: Explained: How India's punitive steps will continue to hit Pakistan
content: Despite the India-Pakistan ceasefire, India's economic measures against Pakistan remain in effect. These actions, initiated after the Pahalgam attack, include the suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty, impacting Pakistan's water resources and agriculture. A complete ban on direct and indirect trade further cripples Pakistan's economy by blocking $500 million in goods.

title: Lashkar terrorists killed in J&K's Shopian: What we know about them
content: In Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian, three Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorists were killed during Operation Keller. The Rashtriya Rifles Unit acted on intelligence regarding terrorist presence. Shahid Kuttay and Adnan Shafi Dar were identified among the deceased. Kuttay was involved in attacks on tourists and a BJP Sarpanch. Dar participated in the killing of a non-local labourer.

title: Anushka Sharma-Virat Kohli meet Premanand Maharaj in Vrindavan: Top 5 news
content: Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli sought blessings in Vrindavan, while Raj Babbar shared emotional memories of Smita Patil. Navya Naveli Nanda is pursuing entrepreneurship, and Ajay and Yug Devgn are dubbing for 'Karate Kid: Legends.' RJ Mahvash humorously addressed her approach to love amidst rumors with Yuzvendra Chahal, creating buzz in entertainment headlines.

title: How Joe Cardona was signed by the Miami Dolphins within 10 days
content: Mike Vrabel explained the Patriots' decision to release Joe Cardona. They signed Frederick Julian Ashby II. Vrabel cited Ashby's potential as the reason. Joe Cardona, a long-time Patriot, then joined the Miami Dolphins. This move marks the end of an era for some Patriots fans. Social media reacted strongly to Cardona's departure and subsequent signing with a division rival.

title: Anupamaa's Rupali Ganguly urges celebs and citizens to #BoycottTurkey amid India-Pakistan conflict
content: Rupali Ganguly, famed as Anupamaa, staunchly defended India amidst rising tensions with Pakistan. She rebuked Pakistani actor Fawad Khan's criticism of Operation Sindoor, asserting his work in Indian films was also 'shameful'. Ganguly urged Indians to boycott Turkey for its controversial stance.

title: RJ Mahvash calls herself 'dumb' in love amid dating rumours with Chahal
content: Social media sensation RJ Mahvash is making her acting debut in the web series 'Pyaar Paisa Profit.' Amidst promotions, she revealed her relatable approach to love, admitting to overlooking red flags, similar to her character. Previously, Mahvash and cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal sparked dating rumors, which they denied, though public support continues.

title: CBSE results: 93.66% pass in class 10, 88.39% in class 12
content: The CBSE has declared the Class 10 and 12 results for 2025, with pass percentages of 93.66% and 88.39% respectively. Girls outperformed boys, and southern regions like Trivandrum and Vijaywada topped in both boards. Foreign schools and CWSN candidates delivered impressive performances, while over 3 lakh students scored above 90%. Despite a high number of achievers, over 1.4 lakh students in Class 10 were placed in the Compartment category, highlighting areas needing academic intervention.

title: Anushka Sharma visits Vrindavan with Virat Kohli after his retirement
content: Following his Test cricket retirement announcement, Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma sought blessings at Vrindavan's Kelly Kunj Ashram from Shri Premanand Govind Sharan Ji Maharaj. A video showed the couple's humble visit, highlighting their spiritual connection with the guru. Anushka inquired about the power of chanting, receiving an insightful response about finding peace through devotion.

title: Tendulkar and Kohli gave India 33 years of stability at No. 4. Who next?
content: With Virat Kohli retiring from Test cricket ahead of the five-match Test series in England, the big question for Gautam Gambhir and Ajit Agarkar will be who bats at No. 4 for India in Test cricket. The position for the past three decades has been owned by Sachin Tendulkar and Virat Kohli. Now, with Virat's announcement, India will have to look for options. Timesofindia.com spoke to several experts on figuring out who can be India's next mainstay.

title: Viral video: Virat Kohli speaks for the first time since Test retirement
content: Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma visited Vrindavan Dham after Kohli's Test retirement. They sought blessings from Swami Premanand Maharaj. A video shows Kohli expressing peace with his decision. Kohli's retirement marks the end of a significant Test career. He leaves behind a legacy of runs and leadership. His influence will continue to shape Indian cricket.

title: IndiGo, Air India cancel flights to these airports - check list
content: Amidst tensions between India and Pakistan, airlines like Air India and IndiGo cancelled flights to several northern destinations on May 13th after briefly resuming services. The shutdown of 32 airports had earlier severely affected flight services, resulting in more than 300 daily flight cancellations.

title: Virat Kohli: The dressing room DJ who nailed Ishant Sharma's mimicry
content: Virat Kohli's sudden retirement from Test cricket has sent ripples through the cricketing world. Among those is his former India and Delhi teammate, Shikhar Dhawan. In an exclusive interview, Dhawan fondly recalls not just Kohli's on-field heroics but also his vibrant presence in the dressing room. From celebrating Dhawan's debut century with infectious energy to his playful mimicry of teammates like Ishant Sharma, Dhawan paints a picture of Kohli's multifaceted personality.

title: Posters of Pahalgam attack suspects surface; Rs 20 lakh bounty announced
content: Following the deadly Pahalgam terror attack on April 22, which killed 26 people, Jammu and Kashmir Police released photographs of three suspects, offering a ₹20 lakh reward for information. The TRF claimed responsibility, leading to India's Operation Sindoor targeting terrorist installations in Pakistan.

title: Exclusive: 'There's only one Tendulkar and there's only one Kohli'
content: In an exclusive interview with Timesofindia.com, former South Africa cricketer Mark Boucher goes down memory lane and recollects the time he shared the dressing room with a young Virat Kohli during his three-year stint with the Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) from 2008-10. The former gloveman revealed how he helped Kohli hone his technique against short-pitched bowling and explained why his eagerness to learn and aggressive mindset laid the foundation for his stellar career.

title: CBSE Class 10 result declared at cbse.gov.in with 93.66% pass rate
content: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has declared the Class 10th Results for 2025, with a national pass percentage of 93.66%. The Prayagraj region saw a decline, with a pass percentage of 91.01%, dropping to 15th place. Students can check their results on official CBSE websites or access digital marksheets through DigiLocker, UMANG app, and SMS-based services.

title: Ferozepur woman injured in Pakistani drone attack dies; first civilian casualty in Punjab
content: Sukhwinder Kaur, 50, has died from injuries sustained in a drone attack in Khai Pheme Ke village, Ferozepur. She succumbed to her injuries at DMC hospital. Her husband, Lakhwinder Singh, is currently admitted at DMC, while their son, Monu, is receiving treatment at a private hospital in Ferozepur. The family sustained injuries in the drone attack, prompting medical intervention.

title: Infosys employees brace for lower bonus payouts; here’s why
content: Infosys employees face reduced performance bonuses for the quarter ending March 2025 due to decreased profits, amidst industry uncertainty. While salary revisions occurred in February, net profits declined by 11.7%

title: Pollachi rape-blackmail case: All you need to know about 2019 scandal
content: In the 2019 Pollachi sexual assault case, all nine accused were sentenced to life imprisonment until death by a Coimbatore court. The Tamil Nadu government has been directed to provide Rs 85 lakh in compensation to the eight survivors. The case, involving widespread sexual assault and blackmail, triggered public outrage and statewide protests, highlighting violence against women and digital exploitation.

title: Kohli visits Vrindavan with Anushka Sharma just day after test retirement
content: Following his surprising Test retirement announcement, Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma were seen in Vrindavan, seeking a peaceful break. They visited their spiritual guide, Premanand Maharaj, after Kohli's major decision to step away from Test cricket. Anushka shared a heartfelt tribute, celebrating his strength and evolution, hinting at travel plans for the couple's future.

title: Border tension spurs Hyderabad missile firms to fast-track supplies
content: Following Operation Sindoor, the Indian government is expediting missile production. Manufacturers in Hyderabad are working to quickly deliver critical systems for missiles like BrahMos and Akash. The Defence Ministry is also engaging with drone and anti-drone tech companies to enhance capabilities. Commanders have procurement rights to address vulnerabilities, especially aerial threats.

title: 'Virat ko chhod do, dusre bhai ko padha likha lo': The making of Kohli
content: Atul Wassan recalls a young Virat Kohli's early days, recognizing his special talent at age 12. Wassan nurtured Kohli, selecting him for Ranji Trophy. Kohli's impact on cricket is undeniable, similar to legends like Hayden and Gilchrist. After retiring from Test cricket, Kohli aims to enjoy life, focusing on IPL and potentially the Olympics, prioritizing family and personal fulfillment.

title: India-Pak tensions: Tharoor lists 4 reasons why Trump’s remarks are 'disappointing'
content: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor has strongly criticized Donald Trump's remarks on India-Pakistan tensions, deeming them 'deeply disappointing.' Tharoor argues Trump's stance risks reversing diplomatic progress by equating victim and perpetrator, offering Pakistan an unearned negotiating framework, internationalizing the Kashmir issue, and re-hyphenating India and Pakistan.

title: Man arrested after fire at UK PM Keir Starmer’s home in London
content: A 21-year-old man has been arrested in London. He is suspected of arson. The fire occurred at a property linked to British Prime Minister Keir Starmer. The incident took place early Monday. The London Fire Brigade responded promptly. The fire caused damage to the entrance. Investigations are ongoing. Starmer's spokesperson thanked the emergency services. Further comments will be provided later.

title: Official vs unofficial websites to check CBSE class 10, 12 results
content: As CBSE prepares to declare the 2025 Class 10 and 12 results, students are advised to use only official platforms like cbse.gov.in, results.cbse.nic.in, DigiLocker, UMANG, SMS, and IVRS. The article outlines how to access results securely, highlights risks of unofficial portals, and provides step-by-step instructions for safe result checking. It also explains CBSE’s digital infrastructure and stresses the importance of avoiding fake sites during high-traffic periods.

title: Government will extend full support for Taekwondo tournaments: Minister
content: International coach Abbas Sheikhi travelled from Iran and shared with the participants about the rules, regulations and techniques

title: Pollachi sexual assault case verdict 2025: a package
content: A compilation of The Hindu’s coverage on the judgment given in the 2019 Pollachi sexual assault case in May 2025

title: JSP leaders conduct special prayers at various temples for Indian armed  forces
content: Civil Supplies Minister Nadendla Manohar, MLC Pidugu Hariprasad and others conduct prayers at the Kanaka Durga temple, while Tourism Minister Kandula Durgesh performs a special puja at the Sri Kumara Subrahmanya temple in Bikkavolu

title: BRS holds govt. responsible for heat-stroke deaths of farmers waiting for disposal of paddy
content: Party leader T. Harish Rao demands ex gratia payment to families concerned stating that they are deaths due to govt. negligence

title: Rahul Gandhi to interact with Bihar students on May 15: Kanhaiya Kumar
content: The NSUI national in-charge alleged that the education system of Bihar has become the biggest failure of the double engine government led by Chief Minister Nitish Kumar

title: Koppal’s fair showcases region’s mango diversity
content: The 10-day exhibition and sale of different varieties of mangoes was inaugurated at the Horticulture Department’s premises in Koppal

title: Leaders urge govt. to revive sugar factories in Vizianagaram
content: Sugarcane cultivation has declined from 4500 hectares to below 3,000 hectares is due to the closure of these factories

title: Ministers Lokesh, Ramprasad Reddy express shock over death of four in Palnadu road accident
content: They direct officials to ensure adequate medical care to the injured; extend condolences to the bereaved families

title: ‘Magic healing’ case against Assam church leader dismissed
content: The Assam Christian Forum said Pranjal Bhuyan was falsely accused of engaging in faith healing with the intent to convert people

title: Trade was never discussed with U.S. officials: India on Trump claims of averting India-Pakistan nuclear conflict
content: MEA spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal says India’s long-standing position on Kashmir has been that it is a bilateral issue between New Delhi and Islamabad and there is no change of this stand

title: New German Chancellor faces uphill battle amid Trump Tariffs and slowing economy
content: Germany’s economy has contracted for two straight years; tensions have risen since Trump’s tariff announcement on the EU; as an EU member, the country cannot act alone on tariffs, and the EU is unlikely to retaliate since its major U.S. imports include oil, gas and pharmaceuticals, says an expert

title: West Bengal introduces environmental science in schools
content: The subject, to be rolled out in phases, will offer students a structured foundation in sustainability and environmental disciplines, starting with key districts

title: Lanka Dinakar calls for coordinated efforts to achieve Viksit Bharat, Swarnandhra goals
content: Departmental coordination vital to overcoming challenges and developing Bapatla as a model district, says Twenty Point Programme Implementation Committee Chairperson during a review meeting on centrally-sponsored schemes and infrastructure projects

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Supplier of drug bought by film directors yet to be tracked down
content: Film directors Khalid Rahman and Ashraf Hamsa and another accused, Shalif Muhammad, were caught from an apartment when they allegedly were  about to use the suspected drug during a pre-dawn raid on April 27

title: Security tightened in Dharwad district
content: In the wake of Indo-Pak conflict and to contain possible repercussions, the Police Department has taken several measures to ensure law and order and also for safety of people and properties in Dharwad district.

title: Piyush Goyal to lead team of officials to Washington for trade talks from May 17
content: During the visit, Piyush Goyal will hold meetings with U.S. Trade Representative (USTR) Jamieson Greer and U.S. Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick on the agreement

title: Singer Sonu Nigam moves Karnataka High Court seeking quashing of criminal case over Kannada remark
content: Based on a complaint by T.A. Dharmaraj, president of the Bangalore City District Unit of the Karnataka Rakshana Vedike (Narayana Gowda faction), the Avalahalli police had lodged an FIR against the singer.

title: NDA win in Assam panchayat polls endorsement of PM Modi's people-centric policies: Amit Shah
content: This victory is an endorsement of PM Shri Narendra Modi ji's people-centric policies that have brought about a new era of peace and prosperity in Assam, says Union Home Minister Amit Shah

title: Congress getting votes from minority community due to their fear about BJP, claims Assam CM
content: Gogoi, Bordoloi and Hussain — all three Lok Sabha MPs from the State — have won due to “this fear factor among the minorities, says Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma

title: Monsoon may hit Telangana by first week of June
content: After hitting Kerala, the monsoon can sometimes slow down or pause briefly: former head of MET Centre in Hyderabad

title: Belagavi police debunk fake news about RSS attacking army officer Sofia Qureshi’s family
content: A picture of a ransacked home and an image of the officer who briefed the media during Operation Sindoor were shared along with a message in English, that said RSS activists had attacked her family members.

title: Daily Quiz | On Virat Kohli
content: Virat Kohli has called it a day on his test career after sculpting a legendary carrer. Here is a quiz on the former Indian skipper

title: Former chief minister Jagan calls on martyred soldier’s family
content: YSRCP chief consoled the bereaved parents and announced an ex gratia of ₹25 lakh on behalf of the party

title: Dargah demolition row: SC asks for Uttarakhand's reply on contempt plea
content: The plea has alleged that a dargah in Dehradun was demolished in the intervening night of April 25-26 without any notice, despite the assurance given before the apex court by the Centre on April 17 in the matter concerning a challenge to the Waqf (Amendment) Act, 2025

title: Pollachi sexual assault case: T.N. CM Stalin, Opposition leaders welcome verdict
content: “Let the ‘sirs’ who tried to protect the group comprising an AIADMK culprit bow their heads in shame if they have any dignity,” Mr. Stalin said; Edappadi K. Palaniswami, referring to the CM’s comment, said unlike him, the previous AIADMK government “did not try to protect anyone.”

title: India records 5.4 mn displacements due to disasters in 2024, highest in 12 years: Report
content: Displacements in 2024 were due to floods, storms, and violence, with Assam and West Bengal most affected

title: Bomb scare on Mumbai-bound plane at Kolkata airport
content: The passenger was detained after he told the airline’s security officer that he had a bomb, an Airports Authority of India  official said

title: A.P. liquor scam: SIT arrests Bharati Cements director Balaji Govindappa in Mysore
content: Mr. Balaji Govindappa, an accused in the alleged multi-crore Andhra Pradesh liquor scam, was  absconding for the last few days.

title: Where are terrorists who infiltrated India and killed 26 tourists in Kashmir, questions Karnataka Minister Priyank Kharge
content: Referring to United States President Donald Trump’s repeated claims of successfully mediating a ceasefire between India and Pakistan, Mr. Priyank demanded a special session of Parliament to place all facts before the nation

title: Karnataka BJP to launch Tiranga Yatra in Bengaluru on May 14
content: BJP Karnataka unit president B.Y. Vijayendra said that party’s national president J.P. Nadda had instructed party workers to take out Tiranga Yatra across the nation

title: Watch: Who is Justice B.R. Gavai, the new Chief Justice of India?
content: Justice Gavai will become only the second Dalit Chief Justice of India, after Justice KG Balakrishnan

title: Special cell to approve high-rise building plans within 72 hours in A.P.
content: The newly formed cell will process development permissions for projects comprising 12 floors or more,  within Service Level Agreement (SLA) of 72 hours

title: A.P. govt. initiates restructuring of State-run schools to optimise infrastructure, personnel
content: The objective of the restructuring is to improve learning outcomes of children studying in Government schools

title: ‘Savukku’ Shankar moves Madras HC seeking CBI probe into alleged scam in manual scavenging eradication schemes
content: His PIL plea is expected to be listed before Justices G.R. Swaminathan and V. Lakshminarayanan on Wednesday

title: ‘Overwhelmed, successor Justice Gavai will uphold Supreme Court’s values’: CJI Sanjiv Khanna demits office
content: The CJI called Justice Gavai his “biggest support” while expressing confidence in the latter’s leadership and commitment to constitutional values

title: Five teams formed to solve holy books burning case in Belagavi
content: MLA Asif (Raju) Sait, who submitted a memorandum to the officers along with the protesters, sought strict action claiming that such incidents had occurred in the past as well and the police had failed to act against the offenders.

title: Goa is not lab for BJP's experiments, says Congress on Centre's suggestion about nuclear plant
content: Union Minister for Power, Housing and Urban Affairs Manohar Lal Khattar said that the Central government has suggested that the states examine the feasibility of setting up nuclear power plants in their respective areas and send proposals

title: Marginal hike in fuel prices in Kolkata
content: A readjustment in the basic price of fuel has pushed the petrol price in the city to ₹ 105.41 per litre and diesel to ₹ 92.02 per litre from May 12, 2025

title: Order blocking YouTube channel ‘4PM’ withdrawn, Supreme Court told
content: “They have withdrawn the blocking order,” senior advocate Kapil Sibal, appearing for the petitioner, informed a Bench of Justices B.R. Gavai and Augustine George Masih

title: Maharashtra SSC Results 2025: Girls outshine boys again as Overall Pass Percentage Stands at 94.10%
content: Girls have once again outperformed boys, achieving a pass percentage of 96.14%, compared to 92.31% for boys, a difference of 3.83 percentage points

title: Four killed, three injured in tragic road accident near Sivapuram in Andhra Pradesh
content: The accident occurred around 9:30 am when a coconut-laden lorry heading from Markapuram to Vinukonda collided head-on with a Bolero Max vehicle in which the victims were travelling.

title: Avoid India Gate: Delhi traffic police issues advisory for Tiranga Shaurya Samman Yatra
content: Delhi Traffic Police advisory warns of heavy congestion and diversions due to planned Tiranga Shaurya Samman Yatra near India Gate

title: Nanthancode murder case: Cadell Jeansen Raja sentenced to life for brutal killings of his family in 2017
content: Court also imposes fine of ₹15 lakh. If recovered, amount is to be paid as compensation to his uncle, Jose, the prime witness in the case

title: When Nizam-era Hyderabad ensured pilgrimage parity
content: The Service Rules were ammended, officially granting Hindu employees six months of leave with advance salary to undertake religious yatras

title: CBSE results: Tamil Nadu registers 98.48% pass rate in Class 12, 99.86% in Class 10
content: The CBSE Class 12 and Class 10 results were announced on Tuesday (May 13, 2025), with the national pass percentage recorded at 88.39% and 93.6%, respectively

title: Two crude bombs recovered from field in Kerala's Kannur
content: Explosives found by landowner while cleaning the property with workers. Bombs were discovered under a coconut tree

title: CBSE Class 10 results: Thiruvananthapuram, Vijayawada top with 99.79% pass rate
content: Thiruvananthapuram region, comprising Kerala and Lakshadweep, registers pass percentage of 99.79, marginally up from 99.75 last year

title: Partially correct picture on Kerala’s financial status being spread, says CM Pinarayi Vijayan
content: Pinarayi Vijayan says those supposed to portray a clear picture about the State are not doing their job to protect their own vested interests

title: PM Modi visits Adampur air base, says India ‘eternally grateful’ to armed forces
content: Mr. Modi’s visit to Adampur air base in Punjab comes after days of intense conflict between India and Pakistan following Indian strikes in terror sites in the neighbouring country on May 7 under Operarion Sindoor.

title: CBSE board Class 12 exam results 2025 are out: How to check?
content: The students who participated in the Class 10 and Class 12 exams can access their results in these websites

title: Hyderabad’s RGIA dismisses viral video about terrorist movement as misleading, says footage is from mock drill
content: The airport officially clarified that the visuals seen in the video were from a mock drill conducted as part of routine preparedness measures in light of the ongoing security situation

title: Mundra port drug haul: SC dismisses bail plea of Delhi-based businessman
content: The Bench termed the allegation of terror financing against Talwar as premature and directed the special court to list the matter twice in a month for expeditious conclusion of trial in the case.

title: Kerala Police rule out theft in ‘lost and found’ gold rod from Sree Padmanabhaswamy temple
content: Last week, temple authorities reported missing the alloy rod used for soldering and welding at temple. This caused a public furore, with initial media reports suggesting that the temple had lost a religious artefact

title: CBSE Class 12 results: Thiruvananthapuram region slips to second position
content: The region, comprising Kerala and Lakshadweep, registers a pass percentage of 99.32, 0.28 percentage points less than Vijayawada

title: Five Namma Clinics opened in Hubballi
content: KSDB Chairman Prasad Abbayya said that the new Namma Clinic outlets would reduce the burden on KMC-RI Hospital as good healthcare facilities and treatment would be made available in their respective localities

title: CBSE Class 10, Class 12 results declared, girls outshine boys
content: The Board informed that 88.39% students passed Class 12 board exams, marginally up from last year’s pass percentage.

title: 64 students to get gold medals, 863 candidates to receive degrees at UAS Dharwad convocation on May 14
content: The various graduate, post-graduate and doctoral degrees will be distributed during the 38th annual convocation of the University of Agricultural Sciences in Dharwad

title: New NBA mock draft: With Flagg, Harper and Bailey slotted to teams, we project all 59 picks
content: With the Mavericks winning the lottery and the right to draft Cooper Flagg, here's ESPN's updated two-round mock.

title: Tatum carried off in Celtics' Game 4 loss; MRI next
content: Celtics star Jayson Tatum will have an MRI on Tuesday after suffering an apparent noncontact lower leg injury late in the fourth quarter of Boston's Game 4 loss to the Knicks on Monday night.

title: Vikings draw historic double in international slate
content: The Vikings will become the first team in NFL history to play consecutive international games in different countries this season.

title: Edwards' halftime talk sparks Wolves to 3-1 lead
content: Anthony Edwards jump-started the Timberwolves with his halftime speech, then scored 16 third-quarter points to lead Minnesota to a Game 4 victory over the Warriors.

title: Eagles, Pack to square off in MNF tush push tilt
content: The first game announced on the "Monday Night Football" schedule will feature the Eagles and Packers.

title: Inspired by Rory, Spieth eyes career Grand Slam
content: Jordan Spieth said he has drawn inspiration from Rory McIlroy as he makes his latest attempt to win the PGA Championship and complete the career Grand Slam.

title: Curry (hamstring) doesn't expect to play Game 5
content: Warriors star Stephen Curry, who is rehabbing a Grade 1 left hamstring strain, does not expect to be available for Game 5 on Wednesday, he told Andscape's Marc J. Spears.

title: Mavericks win NBA draft lottery with 1.8% odds
content: The Dallas Mavericks won this year's NBA draft lottery, earning the right to land projected No. 1 pick Cooper Flagg.

title: Yanks' Cabrera taken off in ambulance after slide
content: Yankees third baseman Oswaldo Cabrera injured his left ankle when he reached back for the plate on an awkward slide Monday night in Seattle.

title: 📈 Tiering who can swing a Giannis blockbuster
content: For the first time in his career, the two-time MVP is reportedly open to a trade. How ready is every team to swing a deal?

title: Rested, recharged, stronger than ever: How Fever's Caitlin Clark used offseason to reset
content: When cameras weren't catching her hanging with Taylor Swift, Caitlin Clark honed her game on the court and in the weight room.

title: Lingering questions on 13 second-year NFL receivers: What's next for Harrison, McConkey and Nabers?
content: Can Marvin Harrison Jr. turn it around? Is Ladd McConkey a true WR1? We answered big questions about receivers from the 2024 draft class.

title: Why Travis Hunter is ready to become a star as first full-time two-way player in 60 years
content: The Jags plan to play Hunter on both offense and defense, and those who have coached him think he will thrive.

title: 'I don't know where I'd be without baseball': How the Palisades Dolphins found 'a safe haven' after losing everything to the wildfires
content: Their school, their field -- even many of their homes -- were destroyed. Now, as a chaotic season concludes, the future of their team is in doubt.

title: Are the Rockies even worse than the 2024 White Sox? Here's what the numbers say
content: Sorry, Chicago. There's a club in Denver taking being bad to an all new low -- and this is how they're doing it.

title: Why the Nuggets' title hopes might hinge on the most volatile player in the NBA
content: Russell Westbrook is perhaps the NBA's most polarizing player. He has single-handedly won and lost games for the Nuggets. But make no mistake: Denver wouldn't be here without him.

title: Trends and shocking takeaways from the Stanley Cup playoffs' second round
content: As we approach the elimination games in Round 2, here are the major storylines -- and what comes next.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: What to watch in critical Game 4 of Stars-Jets
content: Will Dallas go up 3-1, or can Winnipeg tie it at 2-2? Game 4 keys, plus highlights, top players from Monday.

title: Who won the offseason? We look at every Power 4 team
content: Nail the transfer portal? Miss a big recruit? Find a top coordinator job? All are part of a college team's offseason.

title: 10 moves that shaped the WNBA offseason -- and what they mean for 2025
content: Seven head coaching changes. Veterans on the move. Teams rebuilding. Here's a rundown of the key developments.

title: Ranking the top 25 WNBA players
content: How do A'ja Wilson, Napheesa Collier, Breanna Stewart and Caitlin Clark stack up in our preseason rankings?

title: PGA Championship tier rankings: From Scottie and Rory to just happy to make the cut
content: Can Rory McIlroy win his second major of the year? Which LIV golfers can contend? We break down the PGA Championship at Quail Hollow (Starts Thursday on ESPN/ESPN+).

title: Are Liverpool proof coaches don't matter? Or is Slot just better than Klopp?
content: Liverpool were supposed to struggle once Jurgen Klopp left. Instead, Arne Slot won the Premier League. Do coaches just not matter?

title: Brazil announce Ancelotti as new head coach
content: Carlo Ancelotti will be the first foreign coach of Brazil, the CBF announced on Monday. However, Real Madrid are yet to confirm his exit from the club.

title: Mascherano: Everything not 'fine' at Inter Miami
content: Inter Miami CF coach Javier Mascherano has stated that "there are things that need to be corrected" following a poor run of form and 4-1 defeat to Minnesota United on Saturday.

title: Sources: Alonso close to being named Madrid boss
content: Real Madrid are finalising a deal for Xabi Alonso to become their new coach as soon as possible, multiple sources have told ESPN, with the club keen to have him in place for this summer's Club World Cup.

title: Bundesliga champ Kane: What will they say now?
content: Harry Kane has brushed off the criticism he has received during his wait for his first career trophy, saying "we'll see what people talk about now."

title: Wrexham to play July friendlies in Australia, NZ
content: Wrexham AFC will play three A-League clubs as part of a preseason friendly tour across Australia and New Zealand in July.

title: 15,000 'violent' Argentine fans banned from CWC
content: Argentine Security Minister Patricia Bullrich handed the United States Embassy in Buenos Aires on Monday a list of 15,000 violent soccer fans who will be banned from stadiums during the upcoming Club World Cup.

title: France aims to copy Premier League finance model
content: French football intends to have its own version of the Premier League, with a club-owned entity replacing the Ligue de Football Professionnel (LFP) as part of plans announced by French Football Federation president Philippe Diallo on Monday.

title: If anyone can bring the World Cup back to Brazil in 2026, it's Ancelotti
content: The worst-kept secret is out: Carlo Ancelotti is going to be the new Brazil manager. His task -- winning a first World Cup for the Selecao since 2002 -- isn't an easy one, but if anyone can do it, Ancelotti can.

title: Olney: The X factors defining this year's trade deadline
content: Breaking down the the themes that will shape the 2025 deadline and the teams that could be a part of it.

title: Stanley Cup playoff odds: Mikko Rantanen second in Conn Smythe odds
content: Every playoff team's odds to win the 2025 Stanley Cup and favorites for the Conn Smythe Trophy for playoff MVP.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Delap to choose Man United over Chelsea
content: Manchester United have moved ahead of Chelsea in the race to sign Liam Delap. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Zelenskiy Says Only Meeting Putin Face-To-Face Can Deliver Peace
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Tuesday he wanted to negotiate an unconditional 30-day ceasefire face-to-face with Vladimir Putin at this week's talks in Istanbul because only the Russian leader could enact such a pause.

title: High Court Judges' "Unnecessary" Coffee Breaks Find Mention In Top Court
content: High court judges taking breaks "unnecessarily" and too often found a mention in the Supreme Court on Tuesday, which called for their performance audits.

title: Blog: Reporter's Diary: "When Bombs Don't See Your Religion"
content: I wasn't there in Pahalgam. But I read several reports - stories that felt like a heavy burden I couldn't shake off. The victims' relatives said the terrorists asked names and religion before pulling the trigger. Those who weren't Muslims were shot.

title: "i Forgive You": Kim Kardashian To Man Accused In Paris Hotel Robbery
content: Reality TV star Kim Kardashian told a Paris court on Tuesday that she forgave the main defendant accused of holding her at gunpoint to steal $10 million of jewellery in her hotel room during a 2016 robbery.

title: "Looking Square In The Eye...": Shashi Tharoor On PM Modi's Pak Conflict Speech
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi handled the conflict between India and Pakistan "extremely well", Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Tuesday said, as he praised him for Operation Sindoor and sending a clear message through his first address a day earlier.

title: Warplanes, Chandeliers: Trump Gets Royal Welcome In Saudi Arabia
content: With fighter jets and mounted cavalry, Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince Mohamed bin Salman gave Donald Trump a lavish royal welcome in Riyadh Tuesday, as the president kicked off a multi-day tour of the Gulf.

title: BSF Jawan Injured In Pakistani Shelling At J&K Border Dies
content: A Border Security Force (BSF) jawan, who was wounded in Pakistan shelling at the Jammu and Kashmir border, succumbed and his body is likely to reach his native village, Badharia on Tuesday.

title: Bomb Scare On Mumbai-Bound IndiGo Flight At Kolkata Airport, Passenger Detained
content: A plane of a private airline was taken to the isolation bay at the Kolkata airport on Tuesday afternoon for a thorough security check after a passenger was suspected of carrying a bomb, officials said.

title: "Woman From Same Community...": Minister's Remarks On Army Officer Spark Row
content: A Madhya Pradesh minister has sparked a political storm with remarks seen as referring to Army Colonel Sofiya Qureshi, one of the officers who led the government briefings on Operation Sindoor.

title: Exclusive: Before-After Satellite Pics Show Damage To Pak Bases After Indian Strikes
content: India struck multiple Pakistani air bases during 'Operation Sindoor', damaging runways, hangars, and buildings, causing a massive blow to Pakistan.

title: Opinion: Opinion | 'I Did It My Way': What The Timing Of Virat's Exit Says About Him
content: Remember the song Virat Kohli chose for his retirement post on Instagram? Frank Sinatra's evergreen classic, 'My way'. That's the way he played his cricket, and that's the way he chose to ride off into the Test sunset.

title: Ban On 4PM YouTube Channel Lifted, Supreme Court Told
content: The Supreme Court was apprised on Tuesday that the Union government has withdrawn its directive to block the YouTube channel 4PM News Network.

title: How English Language And Other New UK Immigration Rules Will Impact Indians
content: The new rules will introduce tougher English language requirements for visa routes. Adult dependents who come with arriving workers or students will need to show basic English skills to get visas.

title: Akhilesh Yadav Flags Fake X Account Named After Daughter, Demands Action
content: Samajwadi Party president Akhilesh Yadav on Tuesday flagged a fake X account created in the name of his daughter and called for an action against its handler.

title: "Speak Marathi Or Won't Pay": Mumbai Couple Harasses Pizza Delivery Agent
content: For this Mumbai couple, the pizza was not enough, they also wanted the person delivering it to be able to speak to them in Marathi, a detail that they failed to mention when they placed the order, fanning the Hindi-Marathi language row.

title: Election Commission Resolves Duplicate Voter Card Number Issue: Report
content: The Election Commission has resolved the issue of voter cards having similar numbers and those with such cards have been issued fresh ones with new numbers, sources said Tuesday.

title: In PM Modi's Praise Of Modern Weapons, A Bow To A Legendary Horse
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, addressing soldiers at the Adampur Air Force base today, quoted some lines from a poem, which, he said, corresponds to modern-day weaponry.

title: 60 Years Before Op Sindoor, Pak's Sargodha Airbase Saw Legendary Dogfight
content: About 60 years ago, during the 1965 India-Pakistan war, the Sargodha airbase was at the centre of some legendary dogfights between the two air forces.

title: "Pak Used Civilian Flights As Part Of Its Conspiracy": PM To Soldiers
content: Praising the armed forces for meeting the objectives of Operation Sindoor, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday once again highlighted to the world how Pakistan had used civilian flights as a shield, putting hundreds of innocent lives in danger.

title: India's Strength Against Pak Rooted In National Unity Inspired By PM Modi: BJP MP Lahar Singh Siroya
content: India's firm "resolve" against Pakistan in recent days was a reflection of the "national unity" forged by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, BJP MP Lahar Singh Siroya said on Tuesday.
